summary: The bill, titled the Stop Predatory Investing Act (S. 969), amends the Internal Revenue Code to discourage large-scale ownership of single-family rental properties. It disallows interest and depreciation deductions for taxpayers owning 50 or more such properties. Exemptions are provided for property sales to individuals for primary residences or to qualified nonprofit organizations. The bill aims to impact real estate investment strategies and potentially promote affordable housing initiatives.
